required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Trial of Induction Immunotherapy in Locally Advanced or Oligometastatic NSCLC Without a Primary Curative Option
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Trial of Immunotherapy Prior to Resection, Definitive Chemo-radiotherapy, or Palliative Therapy in Patients With Locally Advanced or Oligometastatic Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Without a Primary Curative Option

brief_summary.textblock: In a certified lung- cancer center, patients with NSCLC and a potentially curative stage (including patients with oligometastatic disease) are prospectively enrolled if curative treatment (either definitive radio-chemotherapy or resection) cannot be performed due to large tumor size or for functional reasons. For these patients, the multidisciplinary tumor board (MDB) recommends immuno-(chemo)therapy and re-evaluation. Response is assessed radiologically including PET-CT if indicated. After review of the MDB, patients receive either definitive curative treatment or palliative treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: In a certified lung- cancer center, patients with NSCLC and a potentially curative stage (including patients with oligometastatic disease) are prospectively enrolled if curative treatment (either definitive radio-chemotherapy or resection) cannot be performed due to large tumor size or for functional reasons (e. g. too large radiation field or functionally inoperable for the required resection). For these patients, the multidisciplinary tumor board (MDB) recommends immuno-(chemo)therapy and re-evaluation. Response is assessed radiologically including PET-CT if indicated. After review of the MDB, patients receive either definitive curative treatment or palliative treatment.

primary_outcome.description: proportion of patients completing definitive therapy

secondary_outcome.description: proportion of patients who achieved complete or partial radiologic response
proportion who achieved complete metabolic response

intervention.description: induction immuno-chemotherapy or immunotherapy prior to resection or definitive chemoradiotherapy

study_pop.textblock: Patients with locally advanced or oligometastatic NSCLC (stage IIIA - IVA) wae elegible if curative treatment (either resection or chemoradiotherapy is not possible for anatomical or functional reasons

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- newly diagnosed NSCLC
- histologically or cytologically proven
- stage III - IVA (oligometastatic) by complete staging
- ECOG 0-2
- life expectancy 3 months
- ability to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- primary resectability
- primary definitive chemoradiotherapy feasible
